usefulItems: springform tin (Ø 24 cm), baking paper, long sharp knife, serving plate, shallow freezer-proof containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone), freezer
title: Ice Cream Layer Cake

ingredients.content: 180 g dark chocolate (70% cocoa solids), small pieces or callets

preparations.content: Preparation
Berry Layer
Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer 2 Tbsp to a small bowl and set aside for garnishing.
Add cream, egg yolks, vanilla extract and salt then cook <b>6 min/80°C/speed 4<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place raspberries and blackberries in mixing bowl then blend <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down lid and sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add reserved egg mixture and mix <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>. Pour into a shallow freezer-proof container, set aside to cool, then freeze for at least 8 hours or until solid. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and make vanilla layer.
Vanilla Layer
Place all vanilla layer ingredients in mixing bowl and cook <b>7 min/80°C/speed 4<b>.
Transfer to shallow freezer-proof containers, set aside to cool, then freeze for at least 8 hours or until solid. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and make chocolate layer.
Chocolate Layer
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>.
Add milk, cream, sugar, cocoa powder, vanilla extract, egg yolks and salt then cook <b>8 min/90°C/speed 2<b>.

Transfer to shallow freezer-proof containers, set aside to cool then freeze for at least 6 hours or until solid Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and line sides and base of a springform tin (Ø 24 cm) with baking paper.
Churning and Assembling

Remove berry ice cream from freezer, tip out and cut into squares (3 cm). Place squares in mixing bowl and churn <b>1 min/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and churn again <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Pour into prepared tin, level the surface, then freeze for at least 2 hours. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl.

After 2 hours, remove vanilla ice cream from freezer, tip out and cut into squares (3 cm). Place half the frozen squares in mixing bowl and churn <b>1 min/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then churn again <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Pour into tin, on top of frozen berry layer.

Place remaining frozen vanilla ice cream squares in mixing bowl and churn <b>40 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and churn again <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Pour into tin, level the surface, then freeze for at least 2 hours. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl.

After 2 hours, remove chocolate ice cream from freezer, tip out and cut into squares (3 cm). Place half the frozen squares in mixing bowl and churn <b>40 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then churn again <b>30 sec/speed 6<b>. Pour into tin, on top of frozen vanilla layer.

Place remaining frozen chocolate ice cream squares in mixing bowl and churn <b>40 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then churn again <b>30 sec/speed 6<b>. Pour into tin, level the surface, then freeze for at least 8 hours or overnight.
Serving
When ready to serve, remove from tin and invert onto a serving plate, revealing berry ice cream as the top layer. Garnish with berries and a dusting of reserved icing sugar then serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: Place serving plate in freezer for <b>30 minutes<b> before serving.
